p: Fatty acid composition of the LL muscle indicate that the lambs did not differ ( P > 0.05) in overall fatty acid content (Table 5) when fed different treatment diets. However, the fatty acid composition of the LL muscles showed that lambs fed on T3 had higher levels of sum PUFA n-3 compared to those fed on control diet. Further, the total trans FA and PUFA/SFA appeared to be higher ( P < 0.05) in lambs fed T3 compared with control diet. The proportions of sum PUFA n-3, sum trans FA, and PUFA/SFA were lower for lambs fed on T2 compared to those on the control diet.
